name: CDC Undergraduate Public Health Scholars Program (CUPS): A Public Health Experience to Expose Undergraduates Interested in Minority Health to Public Health and the Public Health Professions
popular_name: John R Lewis Public Health Scholars and James A Ferguson Infectious Diseases Fellowship Program
objective: The purpose of this funding opportunity is to implement a national summer training program to introduce undergraduate and graduate students, including but not limited to those from under-represented and underserved racial and ethnic minority populations, to public health and biomedical sciences.
top_agency_name: Department of Health and Human Services
sub_agency_name: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
applicant_types: Private nonprofit institution/organization (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)

authorizations.text: Sections: 207(f), 301 and 1704 of the Public Health Service Act, [42 U.S.C. Sections 209(f), 241, and 300u-3], as amended.
